se.ltu.android.demo.scene
Class TriMesh

java.lang.Object
  se.ltu.android.demo.scene.Spatial
      se.ltu.android.demo.scene.TriMesh
Direct Known Subclasses:
Box, Quad
public class TriMesh
extends Spatial

A basic geometrical object that is drawn with triangles.

protected float[] center
Local center point of this geometry in x,y,z.

vertices

protected java.nio.FloatBuffer vertices
Direct access to this TriMesh's vertices. If you modify this data you must set the hasDirtyModelBound to true or the model bound will not be updated.

Method Detail

cloneMesh

public TriMesh cloneMesh()
Creates a clone of this mesh. The clone shares vertices, indices etc with the original but the buffers are write protected. If you change the original TriMesh's buffers, those changes will be visible in the clone.

Returns:
the cloned TriMesh

cloneMesh

public TriMesh cloneMesh(java.lang.String name)
Creates a clone of this mesh. The clone shares vertices, indices etc with the original but the buffers are write protected. If you change the elements of the original TriMesh's buffers, those changes will be visible in the clone. The result is undefined if you create new buffers on the original mesh.

Parameters:
name - name of the clone
Returns:
the cloned TriMesh

updateModelBound

public void updateModelBound()
Updates the bounding volume for this mesh This method uses the mesh's world transformation matrix so ensure that the matrix is valid (or call updateTransform() on this mesh before calling this method).

Specified by:
updateModelBound in class Spatial

updateWorldBound

public void updateWorldBound(boolean propagate)
Description copied from class: Spatial
Updates the world bound for this spatial and propagate the changes up to the root if wanted.

Specified by:
updateWorldBound in class Spatial
Parameters:
propagate - set to true if we want to propagate the changes up to the root

forgetHardwareBuffers

public void forgetHardwareBuffers()
Description copied from class: Spatial
When the OpenGL ES device is lost, GL handles become invalidated. In that case, we just want to "forget" the old handles (without explicitly deleting them) and make new ones.

Specified by:
forgetHardwareBuffers in class Spatial

freeHardwareBuffers

Description copied from class: Spatial

Specified by:

generateHardwareBuffers

public void generateHardwareBuffers(javax.microedition.khronos.opengles.GL10 gl)
Description copied from class: Spatial
Allocates hardware buffers on the graphics card and fills them with data if a buffer has not already been previously allocated. Note that this function uses the GL_OES_vertex_buffer_object extension, which is not guaranteed to be supported on every device.

Specified by:
generateHardwareBuffers in class Spatial
Parameters:
gl - A pointer to the OpenGL ES context.

getWorldVertices

public float[] getWorldVertices()
Prior to this call, you should call updateTransform() if the transformation matrix has not already been calculated.

Returns:
an array with the vertices
